passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Smart cameras are capable of analyzing the video feed in real-time. • They can identify objects, track movement, and recognize faces. • Smart cameras have applications in security, traffic management, and retail analytics. • Some privacy concerns arise due to the potential misuse of facial recognition technology.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to emphasize the versatility of smart cameras?

choices.A: Smart cameras are used in security systems because they can analyze video feeds in real-time.
choices.B: Smart cameras, with their ability to track objects and recognize faces, find applications in security, traffic management, and retail analytics.
choices.C: Smart cameras, equipped with facial recognition technology, have raised privacy concerns.
choices.D: Smart cameras use real-time video analysis to identify specific objects in the feed.

explanation: B: 'Smart cameras, with their ability to track objects and recognize faces, find applications in security, traffic management, and retail analytics.' is the correct answer because it highlights the versatility of smart cameras by mentioning their various applications.
distractor_explanation: 'Smart cameras are used in security systems because they can analyze video feeds in real-time.' is incorrect because it only mentions one application of smart cameras, not showcasing their versatility.
'Smart cameras, equipped with facial recognition technology, have raised privacy concerns.' is incorrect because it focuses on privacy concerns rather than the versatility of smart cameras.

'Smart cameras use real-time video analysis to identify specific objects in the feed.' is incorrect because it only describes a feature of smart cameras without emphasizing their versatility in various applications.
